law.catch_line: Publication of list of delinquent child support obligors -- Distribution of "most wanted" posters.

text.section: The Office of the Attorney General shall receive from the Cabinet for Health and Family Services a list of names of delinquent obligors as defined in administrative regulations promulgated under this section.

The Office of the Attorney General in cooperation with the Cabinet for Health and Family Services shall promulgate administrative regulations in accordance with KRS Chapter 13A to implement this section.

The Office of the Attorney General shall:
Publish and update the list on an appropriate agency Internet site; and
Distribute to all designees of the cabinet for the administration of the child support program, a "most wanted" poster that includes names, and photos if available, of delinquent obligors whose whereabouts are unknown or unverified, or who if known, refuse to meet their child support obligations. The poster shall be posted locally by the designee of the cabinet for the administration of the child support program in public locations.

law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 76, effective June 20, 2005. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 430, sec. 16, effective July 14, 2000.
